title: Account suspended for no reason?
body:
I played League of Legends fine all weekend with no problems and for some reason I woke up and checked my email and saw a message saying I have been suspended for 2 weeks for violating terms of use? I didn't do anything to violate the terms of use. Is it possible I was accidentally suspended? I also cannot find details anyone about what they are saying I violated?

Any help is appreciated.

replies.body:
If we issued a suspension on your account, then it was for a very specific reason.  If the message you get is vague, it is because we believe that you would already know what caused the violation, or you would directly contact us so we can discuss it in a private one-on-one conversation.

The best step you can do is to [submit a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) over to us, and we will be able to explain why you received a suspension.

"If the message you get is vague, it is because we believe that you would already know what caused the violation"

you know i am usually on your side but what you uttered there is completely void of sense.

If you want someone to reform, and that's what these "warnings" are for,  you need to specifically tell someone why he is receiving the form of punishment that was issued.
You can not be vague.
That goes against everything what Lyte tried to accomplish.
Reform cards are called "REFORM" cards so you see what the issue is and can act accordingly.

They are not called "guess what you did wrong cards" for a reason.
Most of the time people aren't aware of their negative actions.
So please, be specific,  NOT vague.




ps:
this is not coming to the defense of the OP, this is to hint at the ridiculous notion that one should guess what one did wrong because you believe one should know why the punishment happened.
Honestly I agree. I was a little surprised when he mentioned that I should know what I already did. I created a post specifically stating that I got suspended without any information.

I completely understand your sentiment, and I think I was too vague here. Good call out!  I was trying to walk a thin line between providing info, but also respecting a players individual privacy regarding their account.  Because this player was suspended outside of our normal Player Behavior tools/detection, I erred on the side of caution of not explaining it publicly.  For normal Player Behavior related punishments, absolutely more information is better.  We want to identify exactly what type of behavior caused the punishment so it can be avoided in the future.

I hope that makes more sense!
i agree with what's been said. A message should never be vague about why someone is suspended, even if you believe they already know why.

Thanks for the reply. I submitted a ticket, but I am telling you I played all weekend and last night just fine and I woke up to this. I didn't do anything to earn a suspension. Even if I said a bad word I know I should have gotten a 10 game chat ban before a suspension.
